intro: Rostellularia quinqueangularis, commonly known as the five-angled rostellularia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive five-angled stems and leaves that are typically alternate and ovate. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, often in shades of pink or white. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
